connections.description: The Roman fort of Maia is presumed to supersede Milecastle 80, of which no remains are visible.

references.formattedCitation: Historic England. PastScape: Information on England’s Archaeology and Architecture, 2015. https://www.pastscape.org.uk/.

connections.title: Milecastle 80

description: The Roman fort of Maia located at Bowness-on-Solway, was part of the Roman defenses supporting Hadrian's Wall along the Cumbrian coast.

properties.title: OSM location of Bowness-on-Solway Roman Fort

names.description: Alternate form of the ancient name of the Roman fort at Bowness-on-Solway.
names.details: This name variant is attested on the so-called "Staffordshire Pan" (also known as the "Moorlands Patera" or "Staffordshire Patera").
